programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team relaunches their investigation on Skinwalker Ranch, they are surrounded by a shocking phenomenon.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick, Marty, and the team return to Oak Island and immediately uncover evidence of a mysterious tunnel in the Money Pit. The Fellowship gets a clear look at an underground structure. Are they closer than ever to solving the 227-year-old mystery?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: During the Middle Ages, the Vikings were infamous for being a bloodthirsty band of seafaring warriors. Is it possible that they were not the savage brutes we think of today - but rather, a highly advanced civilisation?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum rack up points testing the merchandise at a pinball paradise; Corey saddles up to a piece of World War II history; Chum sleuths out a sale on a set of Sherlock Holmes books; Rick welcomes Guns N Roses guitarist, ASHBA.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller brings in a WWF prototype figurine, Chum looks to a higher authority to bless the deal. Rick takes a stab at a 19th century knife pistol. Chum celebrates the holidays with an original 1965 A Charlie Brown Christmas soundtrack album.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller Super Bowl Shuffles into the shop with merchandise signed by Da Bears. Chum strikes a jumpman pose as he checks out a bronze Michael Jordan statue. Corey says hello to his little friend--a replica 1963 Cadillac from the movie Scarface.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Its a cold and wet day in Banning, as Laura tries to comfort the buyers with hot cocoa and umbrellas. Brandi changes her plans for a chance at a big win. Kenny risks his money on the contents of a file cabinet.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot, from the movie Grease. Is the flaming hotrod the one that they want, or will they drop out of the deal? Then, Chum takes a whack at a Punch-A-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The team meets with so-called phenomenon-experiencer Chris Bledsoe and his daughter Emily to test their claims to mystical powers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey dart out of the shop to check out a 1968 convertible. Will the negotiations be speedy, or will the duo dodge a bad deal? Then, make no bones about it, Chum wants a piece of an Oreodont fossil. But can he get a dino-mite price?

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick, Marty, and the team return to Oak Island and immediately uncover evidence of a mysterious tunnel in the Money Pit. The Fellowship gets a clear look at an underground structure. Are they closer than ever to solving the 227-year-old mystery?

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The team meets with so-called phenomenon-experiencer Chris Bledsoe and his daughter Emily to test their claims to mystical powers.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are having a picnic. How many apples, cakes and drinks do they have?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is lazing in his sandpit when he hears something that sounds like a tiny invisible engine? “Aww” smiles Messy as he sees it’s only a little buzzing bumble bee! He watches it land on a nearby garden flower and wonders why bees like flowers anyway? He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. Messy lands in Okido, where Zoe and Felix seem very down in the dumps. Whats wrong? Messy asks. They explain they’re sad because their tomato plants haven’t produced any tomatoes just flowers.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy does a BIG sneeze and finds he had a tiny hair in his nose! But its so small he loses it immediately... This gets him wondering, whats the smallest thing there is?! Messy goes to Okido to find Zoe and Felix just in time to catch Zim star as guest on Mayor Okis TV show! Mayor Oki introduces Zim, Okidos expert on everything! but Mayor Oki thinks he knows better than Zim “everything in the world is made of sandwiches” he says! Zim corrects him, “actually Mr Mayor, everything in the world is made of something very small, we call them atoms”.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is reluctant to have a bath so he goes to Dino-World where he endeavours to become as dirty and stinky as he possibly can.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harrys friend Charlie brings her new kitten (Buster) to visit Harry.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Alaskan wilderness, Jayden witnesses a grizzly bear cub being swept away in a river. Hero, Leo, and Katie, in the Garden, are practicing a search and rescue mission, with Heros flotation device when Jayden contacts them about the cub’s emergency. After a quick info segment about grizzly bears, they travel to Alaska in PlatypusOne. They try to chase after the cub but the river then divides into two ways. Unsure which way the cub went, the team split up with Katie and Hero flying ahead with their jetpacks to find the cub. Leo and Jayden then encounter Ranger Rocky who suggests they seek advice from Ranger Joey. Hero comes back to the boys and signals that he didn’t find the cub. Katie then joins them and warns them that the cub is approaching dangerous rapids. Hero is tasked to find the mother bear while the team rushes to the cub. When they reach the cub, it’s clinging to rocks as the rapids are pulling it away. They drop Heros flotation device and Hero practices his rescue skills, enabling the cub to safely reunite with its mother. Back at the Treehouse, they hang a picture of the rescued cub and its mom, concluding the successful mission and in the Garden, Hero is enjoying his well deserved time in the pool.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon is going about his usual business when something extraordinary happens – he can’t stop giggling! What starts as a little chuckle soon turns into full blown hysterics and… Gordon HATES IT! The more he tries to stop laughing, the worse it gets and he’s convinced if Sir Topham Hatt/Fat Controller sees him in this ‘silly’ state, he’ll take the Express from him and give him ‘silly’ jobs instead. Desperately, he heads to Steam Works to be fixed, where he learns that a little bit of laughter doesn’t do anybody any harm!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets Gustavo, a big, blue engine who reminds him very much of Gordon.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Maria ordered way too much stock and if she doesnt sell hundreds of pizzas today, everything will be ruined! Grisu offers to do some advertising to bring people in. After a shooting session, Grisu Stella and Fume distribute and stick flyers and posters around the city. But Fume overzealous sticks his posters anywhere. Grisu has to catch up with his fathers mistakes and ends up burning the cart full of flyers. After his despair moment, Grisu has the idea to do an air show. With his father, they draw a giant pizza in the sky, made with colored smoke...and it works.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stella is taking part in a dance video contest and she asks Grisu to dance along with her. The young dragon accepts immediately. But as soon as they start filming, Fume comes in and asks his son to do dragon training with him. He then unwittingly makes Grisu fall and botches the shot. From then on, Stella and Grisu keep changing location so that they can shoot in a quiet place, meaning without Fume. But the older dragon shows up anyway and ruins the shot, albeit unvoluntarily.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare awakes to find the leaves changing colour and falling off the trees, the flowers dropping off the bushes and the tadpoles turning into frogs. Autumn is here and it’s time for change! Little Nutbrown Hare misses the joys of the Summer meadow. Will he discover that Autumn has it’s own delights?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must be efficient when picking up litter, which means not wasting any time. Wilson and Koko race off, each determined to finish first. Methodical Brewster goes more slowly, sorting the litter as he goes into 3 different bins: paper, plastic and cans. Koko and Wilson deliver their messy loads to the recycling yard – but it won’t count until it’s sorted! While a happy Brewster collects his badge, Koko and Wilson are still sorting their litter....

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Near the riverbank, Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger find a glass jar containing a genuine pirate map! Without a second thought, our heroes decide to go search for the treasure. Quick as ever, Rosie and Scoutbadger spot the clues and solve the puzzles,without noticing that Woodsy has a hard time keeping pace with them. The poor badger feels more and more useless, and eventually decides to give up the search…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo spots a white-bellied sea eagle while flying his kite. Understanding that the sea eagle doesn’t belong in their garden, the Junior Rangers take the sea eagle to a lake where it can find food—and its partner!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A honey bee drops in on Leo’s picnic. The Junior Rangers buzz down to the forest to guide the honey bee back to its beehive, but an encounter with some wasps could prove too much for the Junior Rangers to handle.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon cant get to sleep. He isnt even tired. He tries all sorts of things, but nothing seems to help him get back to sleep.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The little friends decide to get rid of their old, unwanted items and organize a yard sale in the meadow. The old items lead to a lively barter, but a large pile of useless junk remains. The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ruperts sensitive hedgehog nose tells him that the weather tomorrow is going to be fantastic. He at once informs Tilda and the two friends decide to prepare a picnic. The other friends join in and the preparations last long into the night, with Molly and Rupert finally falling asleep in Tildas living room. .

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: In Tildas garden, Robin and another robin are quarrelling over an earthworm. Tilda wants to save the poor worm and distracts the birds by suggesting a competition. First, the robins should compete at cherry stone-spitting. This ends in a draw and Tilda sets the next task: pecking out a pattern in a leaf. Both birds peck out a star, so its a another tie.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One chilly, windy day, Tilda wants to visit her friend Molly. On her way across the fields, she meets Patrick the sheep, whos got a cold. Tilda immediately informs Molly and together the two mice knit Patrick a nice warm scarf. Patrick is overjoyed, but now all the other sheep want scarves too. Now Tilda and Molly have to call her friends in to help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Maelle are racing to touch a big boulder on the beach, but when they both think that they touched it first, they decide to race again with Gaspard as the race referee.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-eyed penguin wanders into Hero’s kennel. The Junior Rangers head to New Zealand to find the penguin’s home, but can they prevent tourists from disturbing yellow-eyed penguins on the beach?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: The parents are hoping Fanni will take her afternoon nap, but she’s still wide awake, playing with her animal sounds toy… Until it stops working… Oh dear! T’choupi quickly steps in and improvises animal sounds. But when he quickly loses interest, Mom comes up with an idea: they should go and find the nearby animals and listen to their cries, straight from the horse’s mouth! With a bit of luck, this pleasant expedition will tire Fanni out enough to send her to sleep…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi leaves the gate to the goats pen unlatched, one of the baby goats goes missing! Finding out about it, he’s anxious it might get into difficulties while out on its own. Benedicte suggests they follow its trail of droppings to track it down. And so off they go on a goat dung treasure hunt through the forest!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Ah ah! Today is going to be a great game of hide-and-seek! But, Hic, suddenly, Hic, Charley has terrible hiccups! Everyone tries to get him to pass - but nothing works. And its not easy playing hide-and-seek with hiccups: Charley is constantly being discovered by a hilarious Ben! Charley doesnt feel like playing any more, Hic... But then Medhi makes him an offer...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In an attempt to beat Thomas in a race, Cleo decides to use the railway lines instead of the road. She soon learns that the roads are much safer for a little car.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia uses what she learns about lighthouses to suggest covering a big wheel in Christmas lights, so Harold can see where he is going in a storm

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is worried theres a monster under his bed, so Daddy checks to make him feel better!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends tell spooky stories at a sleepover!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: One of Monkey’s favorite snow activities is to build snow monkeys an activity Polar bear was happy to participate in. He was even happier to play in Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey finds it is hard to build a sand castle and keep it whole especially when someone constantly makes holes in it… When monkey realizes that the naughty digger is his friend the Crab, monkey decides it is time for his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Hannah, James, Mandy, Sarah and Norman have been using Joe’s Growmaster 2000 to produce their giant Pumpkin. James, pulling the pumpkin balanced carefully across four Go-Karts, heads downhill. The Go Karts, and James go flying down towards the park. Sam must rescue James as the Go-Kart is heading straight for the cliffs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy needs more bees! When Mandy competes with James to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel, she knocks over Malcom’s smoker and starts a fire! The Firefighters rush to put out the fire AND save the bees.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin wants to make breakfast for the family all by himself. When his efforts prove fruitless, he finally asks for help from his Mom, leading to a great breakfast for everyone. /When Franklin and Fox switch roles in an upcoming play, taking on jobs they’ve never done before, it takes a while for them to realize that new challenges are more fun when you’re not afraid to ask for help from those ‘in the know’.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is looking very gloomy today, but his family has no idea why. Rosie and Scoutbadger decide to do everything they can to find out what is wrong with him. They try to make him confide in them, to follow him around discreetly, to question his friends… eventually making Woodsy angry: he doesn’t want to talk about it, and that’s it!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for his little dinosaur everywhere and Doodleboo offers him to do an archaeological excavation in the toy box! Sketcky, having found it, learns that thanks to archeology, there are other extraordinary beings too. Moreover, Doodleboo knows something that is even better and more prehistoric than dinosaurs...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketckys friends are coming soon and he still does not know what hes going to serve them. It should be something everyone loves but not too difficult to cook. Doodleboo will help him prepare a gourmet meal thanks to his Riddleboo!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: For Sketcky, imitating a baby is easy! One just needs to cry. However, succeeding in comforting him is more complicated. Doodleboo surely has an idea of Riddleboo that can help them calm the crying baby.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty find his matching green ice skate. Understanding that a pair is two things that look the same and go together, they have fun matching pairs by shape, size and colour. They eventually find Hatty’s missing skate at the ice rink next to two a pair of identical snowmen. And there’s still time to look for two pairs of hockey sticks and team up in pairs to enjoy a game of ice hockey!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave put on a show for Hilda the Cow, to thank her for all her hard work down on the farm. They make up a play about Hilda planning a dance party for all her friends and choose costumes, props and sound effects to help tell their story. Tweet directs the action, Ruff-Ruff plays Farmer Fred and Dave stars as Hilda the Cow. Despite some mishaps the show is a triumph and Hilda is inspired to throw a real party!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is drinking his afternoon tea when he discovers Monkey building a bizarre looking extension to the tree house that soon enough falls apart... Mole appears and explains how the beaver is such an amazing builder... they decide to venture to the lake to learn from the beaver. Watching beaver work inspires a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The kids of Pontypandy join Moose Roberts on the last night of his month-long charity sleepout challenge. But when James tries to break Moose’s ‘foraged-food only’ rule by toasting a marshmallow, he ends up starting a forest fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When the PA system blows out and sparks a fire at the Pontypandy Fun Run, it’s all hands-on deck to stop the spreading flames!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Moths are spoiling an outdoor dinner for Kate and her parents. In Mimiloo, all of Kate’s friends are hiding from a dragon that’s after Gobble’s moon flowers! But when the dragon turns out to be more friendly than fearsome, Kate leads her friends on a quest to help the dragon find its way home.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to fix her pop-up book without Mom’s help. In Mimiloo, everyone’s preparing to watch the butterfly flowers fly away after sunset. To get a good view, Tack tries to build a lighthouse all by himself—but loses his light bulb in the process! Kate must convince him that he needs his friends’ help to get his lighthouse working.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful Butterfly Hotel! But when the edifice is finally ready… another animal - one that is not at all to T’choupi’s liking - moves in instead!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the trail. Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited for her Aunt Emilys visit, but when Emily gets sick, she decides to send her photos. However, her friends make it difficult to take perfect pictures until the costume box provides a funny solution.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy bit off more than they can chew! They have picked so many plums that the Fox-Badger family will never be able to eat them all before they rot… Margaret asks the children to find solutions to avoid such a waste. Our three little heroes first think of giving them away to the neighbors, but there’s still plenty of plums left.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets ready for his first day back at school and Mommy packs him a lunchbox surprise!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou learns how to make fresh pasta and pizza at home!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: The trainees are having an exciting stunt training session with Action Chugger, when he is called away to do some filming. As he leaves, Action Chugger invites Brewster and Koko to come down to the film set later to demonstrate the skills they have learned. But Brewster gets called on a long run to Tootington and has no time to practise. Koko goes with him to keep him company - and puts her new skills to use when she saves Brewster from a runaway wagon! When they go to the film set later, Brewster is relieved when Action Chugger is too busy to see them, as he hasn’t had a chance to practise.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: On an icy winter’s day, Wilson and Koko are sent out to sand the tracks in the mountains. They take a short cut through the ice cave. Koko does everything properly, but Wilson doesn’t keep his mind on the job, as he has fun exploring. He doesn’t realise that an icicle has fallen into his sand wagon, wetting the sand and rendering it useless. He’s stuck! He figures out a way to dry the sand by using the heat from his engine and makes it back to the depot - after finishing his job, of course!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

Understanding that a pair is two things that look the same and go together, they have fun matching pairs by shape, size and colour. They eventually find Hatty’s missing skate at the ice rink next to two a pair of identical snowmen. And there’s still time to look for two pairs of hockey sticks and team up in pairs to enjoy a game of ice hockey!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Which fairytale character can be transformed by magic? Doodleboo explains how to draw a frog

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo and Picos day in the Galapagos Islands takes a turn when they discover a flightless cormorant with a hooked line entangled in on its foot. In the garden, tries to climb a tree to get to a squirrel but fails. Peyo calls Leo and Katie and the rangers learn about the unique birds characteristics. Leo, Katie, and Hero join Peyo in the Galapagos, using PlatypusOnes hoverboard to navigate the shallow waters and the team patiently waits for the cormorant to resurface. Leo successfully removes the fishing line and the team relocates the birds to a safer habitat with other cormorants. Back in the garden, Hero continues to climb the tree to continue his squirrel chase and falls down to Leo and Katie’s concerns but it is revealed he has his jetpack on.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie dreams of winning this years Raffle prize: a set of colored paints! So when she learns that the Cats intend to cheat in order to win it, only to waste it away… she makes a bad decision: she’ll be cheating too.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia sleeps badly, disturbed by a nightmare that comes back every night. In order to help her find back her sleep and her dynamism, Sam invents a trap to capture bad dreams. Will it work?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Despite all Mommies’ effort to fix it, there is nothing to do, the door of the Triplet’s closet is definitely broken. It opens automatically every time someone closes it and it makes an awful shrilling noise. Instantly, the Triplet’s imagination goes wild, all the more that they just read a book about a knight ghost who haunts a dirty old castle. For them there is not doubt, their closet is haunted! What reassures not at all Poet, or Toto!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Tomorrow is my birthday, claims Girl, but Poet and Turbulent disagree: No, mine! they both answer. Mom explains that Triplets have the same birthday. The Triplets are quite disappointed, they each wanted to have their own party and their very own cake. However, Grandpa has an idea: he takes them to the countryside and shows Girl a rose bush which he created especially for her, lends a little plane to Turbulent, as well as a spyglass to Poet. At first, they are each extremely happy...but it is a lot more fun to share your presents, right?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: After discovering their hidden talent for music Wilson, Koko, and Brewster form a band. But, after Kokos horn goes wonky, will the trainees find a replacement in time for them to rock out on the radio?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The kids of Pontypandy join Moose Roberts on the last night of his month-long charity sleepout challenge. But when James tries to break Moose’s ‘foraged-food only’ rule by toasting a marshmallow, he ends up starting a forest fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When the PA system blows out and sparks a fire at the Pontypandy Fun Run, it’s all hands-on deck to stop the spreading flames!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make lemonade that both looks and tastes great. In Mimiloo, Lily has opened her dream cafe, and wants everything to be perfect for a visit from the Queen of the Bunniflies. But when some of her preparations fall apart, it’s up to Kate to show her that things don’t have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to win at pin the tail on the donkey, but she misses. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim want to race against their new friend, Auggie the Froggie, in a leapfrog race. Tack gives Kate a pair of Hoppy Socks so she can jump above Mim-Mim, but they give her an unfair advantage!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou gets the giggles at school, his silliness disrupts the rest of the class. In a rodeo fantasy, an announcer’s (Leo) silly antics are distracting to Buck Buckaroo (Caillou), and Caillou learns that being silly is great, but sometimes you have to shake your sillies out for your friends.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Daddy has to stop playing with Caillou and Leo to run an errand, the boys try to stop Daddy from leaving. Then in a farmer fantasy where a farmer and his farm hand (Caillou and Leo) are bombarded by clingy sheep, Caillou and Leo learn that they can have fun while they wait for Daddy to return.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A storm is approaching and Skiff and Joe, the Lighthouse Keeper, patrol Arlesburgh, helping everyone to prepare for it. Duck and Oliver don’t think a ‘tiny little railboat’ should be out in a storm and it seems they are right when Skiff’s anchor rope snaps and his sail unfurls. Skiff is terrified as he gets blown down the track and right into a tree that lightning has brought down across the branchline. When Skiff realises that both Oliver and Duck are heading towards the tree he manages to raise his sail to warn them and avert a serious accident.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Two Panther Chameleons who want the same tree! The competition is on!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle invites Leo, Katie and Hero out on a hike in New Zealand. A mischievous bird decides to join them as they prepare for the hike. Unfortunately, hes a little too mischievous and steals the key to PlatypusOne. The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Julian and the kids at Greendale School are excited about a Festival of flight - Ted’s coming to talk about aviation and Alf’s bringing Cedric the racing pigeon. Pat has to deliver special jet boots to the school, built by Ted’s inventor friend. Ted will demonstrate them. But on the way to Greendale, Pat stops to help Alf, whose cows have got loose. Pat sees Ajay, out for a day’s bird-watching. Pat has promised to lend Ajay his wellies and asks Ajay to get them from the van, but Ajay takes the jet boots by mistake.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat tries to deliver to the school and find a new lamb on Greendale Fell at the same time.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing accidentally leaves his Hoppity Voosh toy at the park, Amma helps Bing focus and retrace his steps to find it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie catch a firefly in Big City Park and get their chance to make a wish. But making a wish is a lot harder than they think – after all, they love everything they already have. After a whole day and night of not being able to make up their minds, Oswald and Weenie return to the Park only to find that all of the other fireflies have disappeared! Only then does Oswald realise what the wish should be.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie play a game of hide and seek that unexpectedly turns into a game of lost and found when Weenie disappears. Worried, Oswald looks all over Big City in search of his pet and finally finds him – fast asleep under Johnny’s car seat. After making sure that Weenie knows never to hide in vehicles again they all celebrate with free ice cream!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s dressing up time and Timmy plays Doctor! Poor Teddy is sick, can you help Timmy put some plasters on Teddy to make him better?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is running around. He runs so fast that he can feel his heart beating loudly! Why is that happening all of a sudden? When you need to know, go to Okido! Messy lands in Okido onto Zoe and Felixs trampoline. They all jump off, and they notice all their hearts are beating loudly but they don’t know why... Zim and Zam will know though, so off they go to see them. Zim, Zam and Zoom are baking a cake. Zim startles as they enter the lab, he was whisking so fast that his cake mix flies out of his hands and lands all over Zoom!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is having fun on his swing. Back and forth he goes but suddenly it breaks! A disappointed Messy goes off go to Okido to find out why! He lands in Felix and Zoes garden but cant see them anywhere. To Messy’s surprise, out they jump from behind something strange… “Where did these metal trees come from?” Messy asks them and discovers that they arent trees, theyre legs! In fact, theyre legs of Stan Tall, Okidos biggest robot who is helping Zim build a bridge today. So Messy whistles the Okidoodle over and they race Stan to the seaside to get started!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On a beach in Indonesia, Zari finds tide pools littered with rubbish and a stranded bamboo shark in one of the tide pools. In the Garden, Leo is engrossed in a cricket hunt but finds the cricket on top of a slide which Hero tries to climb up. They get a call from Zari as she tells them about the shark and its inability to climb up the tide pool wall. As they arrive, Leo attempts to scoop the shark out, but the shark ends up slipping away. Katie recalls that bamboo sharks can crawl on their fins. The team fills the tide pool to facilitate the sharks escape, only to encounter another hurdle—rubbish-filled tide pools blocking its way to the sea. Ranger Rocky intervenes, and calls Ranger Joey who shares insights into the bamboo sharks ability to survive out of the water for long periods of time. The team cleans the tide pools, ensuring a safe passage for the bamboo shark back to the sea. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the bamboo shark as Hero slides down the slide with the cricket on his head.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working in Brazil when he hears exciting music hes never heard before - batucada! Thomas is pulling cars/trucks that make great percussion sounds when he rolls along. So, when Thomas meets a batucada band, he is invited to start the carnival with his noisy trucks that biff and bash along to the beat. Later on, when hes dropped off the cars/trucks, Thomas is worried that he wont be able to join in with the batucada band. But then something helps him remember how he can take part!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel resents being scolded when he makes a mistake, and takes advantage of Rebeccas good nature.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must go all day without speaking – but there’s a little room for error, as they’re each given three ‘lives.’ Wilson loses one of his lives when he shouts out during a Safari Park tour, chasing away the animals and spoiling the tour. He learns that by concentrating and breathing deeply he can control his need to make noise. Not only does he earn his badge, he gets the extra reward of seeing loads of wonderful animals that only come out when it’s quiet!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has disappeared! The entire family is searching forhim. To lighten up the mood, Scoutbadger and Woodsy say how amusing it is that Grandpa Fox is so distracted. But Rosie gets angry: she won’t allow them to make fun of her Grandpa who has contracted an illness… the illness of forgetfulness. Rosie knows that her beloved Grandpa forgets more and more things,and that’s the problem! He could forget the way back home to the burrow…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A barn owl scares Leo in the garden. The Junior Rangers depart for the grasslands to find a better hunting place for the barn owl.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across a baby Asian elephant while planting an apple tree. To find the elephant’s mother, the Junior Rangers explore the lowland forest.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Lou’s birthday. At school the day before, Simon overhears her saying that the present that she has always dreamed of is a rainbow-colored-butterfly-unicorn-kitty! Of course they don’ exist but Simon is determined to make one for her with some help from Mom. What a wonderful birthday present to offer Lou! It turns out perfectly, it’s beautiful and boy is she going to be happy! Simon and Mommy take the bus to go to Lou’s birthday party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The owl chicks dont understand why the mirror copies them. Mama Owl brings them a new mirror but accidentally places it opposite the old one, so the little owls marvel as they multiply in it. Doctor Owl securely attaches the new mirror in the nursery, where the chicks can play and have fun.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tildas Great Great Aunt Emily is visiting Wild Rose Lane. Rupert suggests they have a competition to decide which of the two mice bakes the better cheesecake. While Emily sets to work in Ruperts kitchen, Tilda discovers an old recipe from her ancestor Eusebia which sounds better than her own.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon learns to roller skate, which turns out to be harder than he thought. As Lou and Ferdinand have skated before, Simon thinks they must be super roller skaters!.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: When a Sunda slow loris lands in the garden, the Junior Rangers quickly learn that they have to return it to the wild. Will they manage to find the slow loris a home? Or will the slow loris end up as a snack for a hungry sun bear?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson and Koko have to feed the animals in the snow, but Wilson can’t find the sheep!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. However, they get a disappointment when they realize their scarecrow isn’t scary at all!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.desc: Suspecting that each others life would be suits them better, Sam and Julia swap places for a few hours. But is Sams life really funnier than Julias? And her life calmer than Sams?

programme.desc: What could be more annoying than losing your banana exactly when you are hungry? Well not to worry, Monkey has asked his best friend the dog to help him. As dog looks for the banana, monkey has another great idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Our amazing Monkey attempts the impossible; juggling 4 snow balls. But the snow balls keep disappearing… It is the seal playing tricks on his old friend! Well, every friend that comes to visit is an opportunity to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy bit off more than they can chew! programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Playing in the rain and in the mud is always funny, but afterwards, one must clean their clothes, and Sketcky, he does not know how to do that. Who could help him?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave bake a carrot cake for the Little Bunnies to help them say thank you to their Mom on Mother’s Day, for being such a great Mom. programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave are excited about going to school to learn new things. programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Blindfolded, T’choupi is having the time of his life playing Blind Man’s Bluff with Nina and Luce!... Until he falls over… right in the nettles! Owieee! programme.title: Sam And Julia
